PIC32CX-BZ Zigbee API Reference
Drivers

The HAL component of the Microchip Zigbee stack includes a number of drivers, which enable additional serial interfaces and provide thin layers that wrap interaction with hardware for Over-the-Air upgrade.

The drivers include:

  • VCP driver emulates VCP over USART interface
  • USB FIFO driver for wrapping
  • OTAU Flash driver (OFD) is used to write data to and read data from the external flash memory device. This driver is embedded into the OTAU bootloader and OTAU-enabled applications
  • Image Storage driver (ISD) is used on the OTAU server device to tranfer a firmware image from the image storage (which is the PC-based application in the provided package, but which can be any appropriate source, for example, a web server).

How to use the latter two drivers is described on the OFD and ISD usage page.

To find out what drivers are supported on the platform corresponding to this Microchip Zigbee package refer to AVR2050: BitCloud Developer Guide, Chapter 9.

The VCP interface

The Virtual COM Port interface is an emulation of interaction with the COM port on a PC. It works exactly as if the UART/USART interface were used. The API for VCP is the same as for UART/USART, though all function has the VCP prefix, but not HAL.

Like for UART/USART, communication may be processed in either the polling mode or the callback mode. See the section for UART/USART for detail and code samples.
